p: Modulation of the RAAS axis is central to the management of cardiovascular disease [ 62]. Cardiovascular disease, heart failure, atrial fibrillation, and kidney disease are associated with elevated levels of ACE2 [ 60]. It is critical to discern if these elevations are a culprit or sequelae of disease in order to separate association from causation [ 63]. More recent opinions suggest ACE2 represents as a biomarker, rather than a culprit, of cardiovascular disease [ 64].
